name: Comfort Suites at the World Golf Village

reviews.text: We ended up staying here after checking into a Comfort Inn on A1A in St. Augustine and finding it full of roaches. This hotel was great, very clean, very nice staff, great rooms, breakfast was great. We even went for a walk after breakfast as we were wasting time until we could check into our condo and the grounds were beautiful. Our kids loved throwing pennies in the fountain in the lobby. Great place to stay!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel was OK, but across the interstate from The World Golf Village in a remote area. Room was dirty, but we got upgraded after complaining. No restaurant and not close to any decent ones. The staff was very diligent in taking care of our complaints. The breakfast was just OK, not anything to brag about.
reviews.title: Not close to World Golf Village

reviews.text: The price is the only thing going for this hotel...and that's because the hotel may be empty. The building is falling apart, the halls and rooms smell musty and sour. Not the quality you'd expect from Comfort Suites. The grounds were not maintained and the front of the hotel was overrun with weeds. This hotel is OFF my list permanently and has jeopardized any future stay at a Comfort Suites or any Choice Hotel for that matter.
reviews.title: Think twice before booking

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at the Comfort Suites at World Golf Village for 2 days. We have a dog and it is hard to find hotels that are pet friendly and really nice. This hotel does not charge a pet fee which is great because if you go to other hotel chains they charge a pet fee of 10 dollars to 25 dollars. The staff was so friendly and kind. The breakfast is a full breakfast bar. There is an indoor and outdoor pool. The suites were comfortable and clean. It is a great value and it is quiet. It is truly a hidden jewel. It is right off of I-95 and the only drawback is that it is 16 miles from Historic St. Augustine but honestly the hotel is really not that far from Historic St. Augustine. I will be staying here again.
reviews.title: A hidden jewel

reviews.text: I took my 3 children for a "getaway" weekend a couple of weeks ago, and found that this place was great; they have an outdoor and indoor pool (what a great asset), and the staff was very friendly and very helpful. Can't wait to go back hopefully in a few months!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked here day before online and got excellent rate. Huge property out by itself with many nice amenities, Bar, indoor pool and small convenience store. Room was very nice and breakfast was great. The down sides were that the wifi was supposed to be only on the first floor with one hard line in the room. We were able to get the wifi on the 5th floor with patience. Ice machines did not work, but you could get ice from the staff on the first floor. The place seems like it just need a little TLC to be top notch. Great location for World Golf Hall of Fame visit.
reviews.title: A little diversion on the way home

reviews.text: Good morning buffet with hot entree's. basically clean rooms. Good bar/lounge for evening winding down. Location good for World Golf Village and St. Augustine . Staff handled all situations. Indoor pool was above average.
reviews.title: Excellent location. Very good breakfast with hot food. Evening bar/lounge.

reviews.text: This was my 4th stay here for our EC12 sailing National Championship and again this hotel and staff were fantastic! With 40 boats and all us skippers they made us feel very welcome and catered for our every need. Sarah at the small but very nice bar was great, she was our barmaid when I first stayed here in 2009 when I met my now husband and she remembered us along with my parents and fellow sailors, she is a great asset to the team in this hotel. The other person who I would like to mention is JJ he was there early making sure everything was clean and tidy and he was still there late at night, he was extremely polite and once he knew we were with the sailors who were there he became my personal cheerleader! Both these employees went over and above to make sure we had a great stay and we will definitely be back as this hotel has very special memories for me and my husband.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay! Wonderful attentive staff!

reviews.text: Let me begin by stating, I would have written this review early but was waiting for some type of response back from my satisfaction suvey that Choice Hotels/Comfort Suites had emailed me. This is our third stay at this location and the facility has detoriated. It has a terrible musty odor, the furnitue in the room looks shabby. In general the whole appearance of the hotel is not pleasant. In contrast the staff were very friendly and helpful. My biggest complaint regarding my stay was, the hotel was and is advertised as a no pet hotel. However when we arrived, the hotel was hosting a "sugarglider" (sugargliders are small marsupials)convention. The animals were everywhere, in the bar crawling on tables and chairs. They also were loose on the floor in public areas. What was most disturbing, is the the bar area also serves as the site for the breakfast service. This practice was unsanitary and quite disturbing to my family and I. Upon check out I voiced my concern and complaint to the front desk clerk. She listened to my concerns and advised me I would hear from the general manager, that was four months ago still wating for a response from the general manager or the corporate office.
reviews.title: Stay Far Away
tired and in need of update
reviews.text: Comaped to other properties we stay at people were friendly but coffee and hot water were empty at mid day. The carpets and furniture were old and worn. The bathroom was clean but very tired looking. The area was beautiful and well kept. I wish the rest of the hotel had been updated. We are choice members and visit many properties up and down the east coast.
Definitely not close to historic at Augustine. Stayed there since we were playing golf at the hall of fame.
reviews.title: Ok, works to get some rest.....

reviews.text: Hotel is clean but does have a bit of a humid smell.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are good size, cable tv, towels are not as bad, shower looked a little worn.
reviews.title: A place to rest your head

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price it's not bad at all, but it does it job.
reviews.title: Great breakfast and cat friendly too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this hotel for the Gator Bowl. We love the location and hotel but with one suggestion. Wireless is not available except on 1st floor and in the lobby area. Please extend wireless to all floors.
reviews.title: Great pet-friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there in July on our way to visit relatives and go on a Disney cruise. The lobby was nice, people working there were nice, our room was nice. EXCEPT for the awful musty smell in the room. The room was clean and more than met our needs but ... I would not stay here again until I was guaranteed that the musty smell was taken care of.
reviews.title: Musty smell takes over review

reviews.text: As others have noted, staff was friendly and helpful and breakfast was a half-step above the usual fare.
reviews.title: Was the furniture purchased at Salvation Army?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed was okay, and room seemed clean. We had a suite with two queen beds.
reviews.title: I feel swindled

reviews.text: However, the furniture badly needed replacement. The couch was unusable. If you can't use the couch, why pay for a suite? Coffee table had dings and mars. TV was a relic - not flat screen and it barely swiveled. The sound on the TV was so variable that we had to watch it with the remote in hand - almost like using a steering wheel.
reviews.title: Fine for the price

reviews.text: I'm getting sour on Comfort Suites - they can be great or wretched.
reviews.title: Great location near world golf village

aka: Comfort Suites At The World Golf Village Hotel
description: 162 room indoor access hotel rooms. We have an indoor pool, an outdoor pool and a Hot Tub. Our two Gazebo's overlook Lake Commerce in the World Golf Village area.
